settings.text: VARVAR is a jewelry company that has been manufacturing and selling jewelry since 2014. Until 2020, the company operated under the Viking Workshop brand. The companyâ€™s workshop and office is located in Kyiv, Ukraine.

We exclusively offer our stunning jewelry collection through the VARVAR website and various other well-established online marketplaces like Etsy and eBay. For your convenience, we've provided a comprehensive list of these platforms along with direct links below.

Our company proudly boasts a team of the finest jewelers in Ukraine, ensuring that every piece of jewelry we offer is crafted with unparalleled skill and craftsmanship.

Additionally, we house a dedicated design department responsible for conceptualizing and bringing to life the unique and captivating designs that adorn our jewelry collection.

In our workshop we make jewelry using 925 silver (sterling silver), bronze and all types of gold - 10K, 14K, 18K, yellow gold or white gold. VARVAR has the full cycle of jewelry production in its workshop: from the first sketch of the future items to the packaging of the finished products in a branded box.

As of September 2023, we present more than 30 different collections of historical and fashion jewelry

Our best-selling collections are:

  • Viking
  • Egyptian
  • VarVar Fashion
  • Pirates

We can craft an individual order with a custom design, make a unique engraving on the ring, and add precious stones to the selected piece of jewelry.

We craft rings (including wedding ones), pendants, bracelets, chains, cufflinks, earrings and beads.

In our jewelry, we use such precious and semiprecious stones as amethyst, garnet, topaz, citrine, sapphire, ruby, emerald, diamond.

Here at VARVAR, we buy gemstones only from the best available suppliers. All stones are tested for quality, beauty, and durability.

settings.heading: June 2014
settings.content: The first idea to create a company

settings.heading: JULY 2014
settings.content: OPENED ONLINE STORES ON ETSY AND AMAZON

settings.heading: APRIL 2015
settings.content: LAUNCHED THE FIRST ONLINE STORE - VIKING WORKSHOP WEBSITE

settings.heading: MAY 2015
settings.content: RECEIVED AND MANUFACTURED THE FIRST 14k GOLD ORDER

settings.heading: JUNE 2015
settings.content: CREATED THE FIRST JEWELRY WITH A PRECIOUS GEMSTONES

settings.heading: JANUARY 2016
settings.content: MANUFACTURED AND SOLD THE FIRST TEN THOUSAND JEWELRY

settings.heading: JULY 2016
settings.content: CREATED MASONIC, BIKER, AND MARINE COLLECTIONS

settings.heading: DECEMBER 2016
settings.content: CREATED OF ITS OWN FULL JEWELRY MANUFACTURING CYCLE

settings.heading: JUNE 2017
settings.content: STARTED WORKING WITH DROPSHIPPING AND WHOLESALE PARTNERS

settings.heading: NOVEMBER 2017
settings.content: THE STAFF CONSISTED OF 10 EMPLOYEES

settings.heading: APRIL 2018
settings.content: CREATED 1,000 UNIQUE JEWELRY DESIGNS

settings.heading: NOVEMBER 2018
settings.content: THE BRAND'S PRODUCTS WERE SENT TO 70 COUNTRIES FROM AROUND THE WORLD

settings.heading: OCTOBER 2019
settings.content: CREATING FASHION JEWELRY COLLECTION

settings.heading: OCTOBER 2020
settings.content: CREATING THE VARVAR BRAND

settings.heading: February 24, 2022
settings.content: The first day since 2014 that production was stopped indefinitely due to the invasion.

settings.heading: March 14, 2022
settings.content: Restart of production in Lviv, shipment of the first orders since the beginning of the war.

settings.heading: May 15, 2022
settings.content: Return back to Kyiv, resumption of the full production cycle

settings.heading: July 2022
settings.content: Opening a VarVar Jewelry branch in France

settings.heading: January 2023
settings.content: Participation in a pop-up store in Paris.

settings.heading: February 2023
settings.content: Taking part in the first jewelry exhibition in Munich - Inhorgenta

settings.heading: March 2023
settings.content: Taking part in the series of local exhibitions in Arras, Mouscron, Rouen, Agen

settings.heading: September 2023
settings.content: Taking part in a grand jewelry exhibition in Paris - Bijorhca
